results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About us

Nomic was founded with the purpose of making biology easier to measure. To do this, we have untangled some of the most difficult problems in protein profiling. Our team is combining DNA nanotechnology, high-dimensional flow cytometry, laboratory automation, and machine learning to develop the world’s highest throughput proteomic platform: the nELISA.

Since spinning out of McGill University, we have partnered with and provided platform access to dozens of drug discovery groups including GSK, 4 of the top 10 pharmas, and leading biotechs.

We have recently launched a state of the art manufacturing and protein profiling facilities that enable multiplexed measurement of >2.5M samples a year, generating an effective 500M protein assays in the process.

We are building a diverse team of engineers, scientists, and world-changers. We like to break down difficult problems using a first principles approach, often leveraging the latest breakthroughs from across the scientific and technological spectrum to drive our mission forward.

 

About the Role

We are looking for our first Sales Development Representative at Nomic Bio. You will be working closely with our co-founders and our Application Scientists to expand our user base and deliver our technology to researchers and drug development scientists.

 

What you will be doing

  • Enable scientists to extend lives by delivering our high-throughput protein profiling platform and expanding our customer base.

  • Research, identify, and reach out to research groups that can leverage the nELISA.

  • Qualify inbound leads and introduce our technology and offerings.

  • Understand the users’ situation, needs, and decision-making process.

  • Maintain lead/prospect contact information and notes in CRM to manage sales prospecting and track activities.

  • Attend conferences and generate and qualify leads.

  • Nurture leads and opportunities where potential users expressed interest but were not ready to purchase at the time of initial contact.

  • Contribute to developing sales materials, playbooks and processes.

     

What we’re looking for:

  • STEM bachelor's or master's degree with a minimum of 3 years experience in Sales or a Customer-facing role.

  • Strong time-management skills including the ability to effectively multitask, and work in a fast-paced environment.

  • Possess strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Be a curious individual with effective questioning and listening.

  • You have a sense of urgency to get things done to enable scientists and extend lives; are driven to deliver and constantly push the boundaries; can-do attitude; determination and high expectations of yourself.

 

Please apply if you:

Connect deeply with our mission, ambition and sense of duty. We developed our technology to better measure biology and discover biomarkers for the early detection of diseases. We firmly believe we will be successful in literally eradicating certain diseases by enabling them to be diagnosed and treated earlier. Are up for a challenge and want to grow: We are a team of problem-solvers, and we continually put ourselves to the test and go into the unknown. We have a growth mindset, and we rely on each other to give critical and candid feedback to ensure that we can reach our full potential.

results.title: (Senior) Account Manager (f/m/x)
results.description:
ELEMENT Insurance AG is a product factory for insurance and a leader in insurance digitalization. We supply our partners from various industries – both from an insurer, as well as a non-insurer background – with in-house underwritten insurance products, which they market under their own brand. Our modular insurance platform enables us to tailor-fit and supply these non-life insurance products in record speed. 

 

Our diverse team with over 30 nationalities combines the expertise of the worlds of insurance and technology. At ELEMENT, we live an agile and empowering company culture to work on ‘the insurance of tomorrow’.

 

ELEMENT's HR department covers the full HR service spectrum. We make it a point to use the latest methods, tools and insights in our daily work and can always count on the support of our management, who are fully aware that our employees are ELEMENT's most important success factor.

We are currently looking for a (Senior) Account Manager - (f/m/x) to help us to develop our client relationships:

 

What Will Keep You Challenged?

  • Be responsible for net growth within key customer accounts and identifying new opportunities within those relationships
  • Establish a thorough understanding of your named account's business strategy, organizational structure, and growth plans.
  • Define with your accounts the ideal product for their end customers and support them to maximize their distribution success throughout the whole customer journey.
  • Develop based on your experience together with the sales team innovative sales strategies for new and classic insurance solutions and implement them with your clients.
  • Control and report the development of your accounts.
  • Keeping up to date with changing market trends in both technical and insurance areas .
  • Capacity to work in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment .

What Will Make You Succeed?

  • Bachelors/ Master's in business, other relevant educations will be considered 
  • Several years’ experience in an account management, sales, or related role – ideally in the insurance industry 
  • Proven record of high performance and substantial achievements in past positions  
  • Solid functional knowledge of strategy, business development, product development, project management, sales and marketing are beneficial 
  • Proficient expertise with CRM software and Microsoft Office programs is essential 
  • Experience with Jira, Salesforce and Online Marketing Expertise (Google Analytics, SEO, Google/Facebook Ads) are a plus 
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to influence others, work well with people on all levels of the organization 
  • Strategic thinking skill and complex problem-solving abilities 
  • Exceptional communication skill, both fluency in German and English are required

Why ELEMENT?

  • The opportunity to be part of a driven and diverse team which is creating a measurable impact on our company as well as the future of insurance.
  • An open and welcoming company culture, empowering you to freely grow and take your career to the next level.
  • We openly share our knowledge – we are a mix of insurance experts, technology specialists and experienced entrepreneurs.
  • We have a dedicated onboarding process, enabling you to quickly thrive at ELEMENT.
  • A direct influence on our company and business – we value your ideas and your input.
  • Plenty of perks including a benefits package of your own design, 30 days of holidays, free drinks and snacks, language classes, company-wide networking events and outings.

 

Research shows that men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria. Meanwhile, women and other diverse groups often only apply if they check every box. So if you might have what it takes, but don't quite meet every single point on the job description, we invite you to get in touch either way and let's discover together if you could be a great fit.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
Genesis is a Ukrainian co-founding company that builds global tech businesses together with outstanding entrepreneurs from CEE. The Genesis business ecosystem includes more than 25 projects that work in 4 areas — mobile applications, online media, classifieds, and R&D. Our applications have been downloaded by more than 300 million users worldwide, with the company's main markets being the United States, Europe, and Africa.

In 2021, we launched a new project - YouTube Multi-Channel Network, Genesis MCN is an official, certified partner of YouTube.
The company's portfolio includes content creators from Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Africa, and other world regions. We help them develop their media business: create, promote and monetize their content in the best possible way.

We are looking for an enterprising and experienced Sales Development Representative and a person with whom we will enjoy joint victories. This role opens up the possibility of professional development in interesting non-standard tasks for various projects and career growth to Team Lead of Sales.

 

What will you do:

  • attracting new partners (YouTube channels);
  • conducting market research;
  • search for potential partners according to the company's criteria and enter them into the hunting table;
  • compiling and sending Follow-up;
  • elaboration of a commercial offer for each partner, depending on his needs;
  • conducting calls and meetings to present the company's services and conclude agreements;
  • dealing with objections;
  • organization of contract signing;
  • creation of a partner card with complete information about the client and its transfer to the marketing manager.

 

About you:

  • 6+ months of work experience in a similar position;
  • English level B2+;
  • know how to find and analyze information;
  • you consider yourself as team player;
  • know how to work with objections;
  • interested in YouTube and video content;
  • understanding of the YouTube platform.

Will be as plus:

  • experience in compiling reports with results and recommendations;
  • understanding Digital Marketing.

 

Why you should join us:

  • We give creative freedom and the opportunity to realize your ideas. We create an atmosphere where everyone is comfortable working, and it is as efficient as possible for the business.
  • Furthermore, we have a strong professional team. At Genesis MCN, we bring together really experienced specialists, each of whom is open to sharing knowledge and is ready to help solve issues based on their experience.
  • Flexibility in decisions - we often have to make absolutely non-standard decisions.

 

In addition, we offer the following benefits:

  • Comfortable conditions and schedule. We provide 20 days of paid vacation per year and a convenient work schedule. 
  • Health care and sports. For example, breakfasts, lunches, unlimited snacks in the office, corporate doctor and health insurance.
  • Communities are the best way to improve skills in a certain field, test hypotheses without harming the business, and find like-minded people. 
  • Training and development: Business and Management School for company employees. A large electronic library and access to paid online courses, conferences, internal discussions, and workshops. Compensation for additional training at external training, courses, and seminars.

 

Join us!

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Accelerating the Web3 transformation journey

Blockchain application development is hard.

Fewer than 1% of developers have experience with this technology but it is increasingly clear that everyone on the planet will be positively impacted in the coming years by blockchain, as meaningful applications are built and adoption increases.

SettleMint is here to make blockchain application development easy for developers, by providing the best high-performance low-code platform for blockchain development for enterprise and public sector.

We abstract away complexity so developers can devote their time and efforts to building game-changing solutions for a better tomorrow.

 

We are a venture-funded global scale-up, and we recently closed our series-A funding of €16 million, co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. We reached a new phase of growth, and we are now going to expand our operations and teams really fast, with clients in financial services, retail, manufacturing, and public institutions across the globe, and offices in Europe (Belgium), MEA (Dubai), India (Delhi), and APAC (Singapore). We work closely with our growing network of partners in all regions enabling them to quickly deliver solutions to their clients.

 

We are a remote-first company, we work async (so you can focus on the actual work) and we empower our team members to take ownership of their work.
We hire the best talents in the blockchain space and we trust their ability to do a great 100%!

Skills, values alignment, and cultural fit are equally important to us, as they will enable top-performing team members to rapidly grow their careers with us.

 

This position is fully remote, but we can only consider candidates based in the APAC region.

 

If this sounds exciting to you, go ahead and apply for this role!

The role

As an Account Executive (for the APAC region) in a hunter role here at SettleMint, you will be responsible for sourcing new customers and business contacts, demonstrating the value and benefits of our Enterprise Blockchain platform, driving sales, and maintaining strong customer relations, with the ultimate scope to increase the license subscription Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR).

In this role, you will act as a trusted advisor for our prospects and customers from a Web 3 and Blockchain perspective.

You must be excited to prospect continuously, to build your qualified sales pipeline. In parallel, you would be receiving qualified leads from the Sales Development Representatives along with leads from our marketing initiatives.

You are expected to be a self-motivated sales professional with a genuine passion to solve customer problems.

Willingness to travel, and attend events and conferences, along with successfully driving end-to-end sales cycles with Enterprises is key for this position.

 

Responsibilities

  • Hunter role, delivering monthly new sales targets by managing a pipeline of opportunities generated by your Sales Development (SDR) colleagues as well as your own prospecting.
  • Nurture prospective clients through the full sales process from product demonstration to trial and close
  • Build and nurture client relationships throughout the sales cycles.
  • Contribute to the growth and development of our product by providing feedback from conversations with your customers and prospects
  • Engage with the Sales and business leadership to coordinate marketing and sales activities
  • Update the CRM to document all activities on opportunities and follow-ups.

What we are looking for

Must have

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Fluently in additional Asian languages is a big plus

  • Prior experience of at least 5 years, in selling SaaS solutions to Enterprise customers (preferably Banking and Public Sector) in the APAC region.

  • You have prior experience (at least 5 years) in full-cycle sales for B2B Enterprise SaaS, with an exceptional track record of meeting/exceeding sales targets

  • You are results-driven, tenacious and a strong team player.

  • You are comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM (eg. Hubspot)

  • You possess excellent communication & interpersonal skills and can liaise effectively with senior stakeholders

  • You have experience in negotiating and closing SaaS deal sizes of at least USD 100k-250K/year in terms of annual contract value (ACV) and sales cycles of 4-8 months

Nice to have

  • Experience selling large enterprises (financial institutions, supply chain etc.)

  • Experience working with Hubspot or other CRM

 

Benefits of working at SettleMint

  • Be part of the Blockchain / WEB3 revolution
  • Dynamic but stable scale-up, with the mission to make blockchain accessible for all
  • A fun team to be in, with high standards and a culture of transparency and collaboration
  • Attractive salary package
  • Commission based on performance
  • Flexible working hours, location, and async work environment
  • Clear targets and clear rewards when you crush them
  • Global colleagues who are passionate, hardworking and smart, just like you!
  • Constant training and coaching on both Blockchain Technology and Sales
  • A fast-growing team that is fired up and passionate about what we do because, well, it is bloody important
  • We care about your growth and development and promote lateral and vertical career progression

 

Application process:

  • Resume screening
  • 1st Interview with Recruiter
  • 2nd Interview with Team
  • 3rd Interview with Hiring Manager
  • Take-home assessment
  • Assessment review (and potentially an additional follow up call)
  • 4th Interview with VP of Finance and/or CEO
  • Reference check
  • Offer

 

Inclusivity and belonging.

SettleMint is inclusive for everyone, and is for anyone.

We encourage candidates from all ethnic, gender, sexual, age, and abilities groups to apply and be part of our company.

We are a very diverse team, and we want to continue our efforts in hiring and retaining the most diverse talents from all over the world.

SettleMint is a remote-first company, with our work culture and company policies centered around remote work. Operating from various locations around the globe, with offices in Leuven (Europe), Dubai (UEA/MEA), Singapore, Tokyo (APAC), and Delhi (India), employees are linked to their nearest regional office but are empowered to work remotely, in the office or anything in-between that they find most comfortable.

We believe in offering employees a flexible workspace to create a happy, productive, diverse and inclusive team.

results.title: Associate VP of Expansion Sales
results.description:
Mural’s mission is to inspire teams to connect and innovate, while bringing purpose and intention to the craft of collaboration.

Mural created the Collaborative Intelligence System™ to power cultures of effective collaboration where everyone is connected, contributing, and empowered to deliver business-driving outcomes.

Founded in 2011, Mural is a leading innovator in visual collaboration for hybrid, remote, and distributed teams. We believe in what we build, and our team of more than 700 “MURistas” around the world collaborate in the Mural® app. Our values guide our intentionally inclusive product and culture, which includes collaboration design education and a flexible monthly stipend for learning, wellness, and coworking.

Mural has raised $200M to date and is growing rapidly to fulfill our mission. The company is trusted by 95% of the Fortune 100, including innovative teams at IBM, Intuit, GitLab, Microsoft, and Atlassian.

YOUR MISSION

As the Associate VP of Expansion Sales, you will work with a team of MURAL Account Executives in North America to ensure successful client and account management. You will be an integral part of MURAL’s success in the United States and Canada through coaching and inspiring your team, supporting the pursuit of large deals, and being a partner in the management of key customer relationships.

In this role, you will:

  • Hire, coach and train a team of Major, Account Executives in North America
  • Work closely with CS leadership to serve and grow North American customers
  • Coordinate MURAL’s presence at any relevant events in North America
  • Drive new logos and ARR with customers in North America
  • Manage and grow existing accounts in North America
  • Participate in company's storytelling to drive thought leadership in the industry
  • Leverage network and existing connections to make MURAL more present at events, conferences and with partners
  • Assess and share the business impact of innovation with MURAL customers in North America
  • Collaborate with marketing and product teams
  • Assist team in building out Account plan for every customer account to ensure we’re deploying the right CS resources that ensure customer satisfaction and growth
  • Build and manage sales process, performance management, and pipeline growth
  • Build and close transactions 500K+ with Fortune 500 organizations.
    Hire, coach, and mentor Account Executives
YOUR PROFILE
  • 8 years of sales management experience selling a SaaS solution
  • Experience in forecasting and delivering on monthly and quarterly billings
  • Strong focus on customer satisfaction by anticipating customer needs
  • Track record of closing large enterprise transactions
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to articulate ideas clearly in oral and written communication

Nice to Have:

  • An entrepreneurial spirit and love taking on a problem head-on
  • You are a self-starter looking for a challenge
  • A healthy competitive spirit at work
  • You are a people person, who enjoys helping others find solutions to problems
  • You are passionate about the intersection between design and technology
  • You are poised and polished under pressure, and an exceptional communicator
  • You are comfortable with conversations that may become detailed or technical
  • You are results-oriented and thoughtfully aggressive

In the state of Colorado, the salary for this role ranges from $353,000 to $406,000 + equity + benefits, but may vary based on your qualifications and job-related experience level, that could result in a level outside of this range.

In New York City, the salary for this role ranges from $441,000 to $508,000 + equity + benefits, but may vary based on your qualifications and job-related experience level, that could result in a level outside of this range.

Please submit your resume in English. #LI-Remote #LI-SS1

WHAT WE OFFER

In addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • 401K (US only)
  • Company equity
  • Health insurance
  • Fertility benefits
  • Muralvida stipend (for fitness, wellness, learning and coworking)
  • Fully remote team
  • Parental leave
  • End of year closure
  • Design thinking trainings
  • Mural free forever plan
OUR VALUES

We bring people to our team that care about our mission to inspire and connect creative people globally, and who feel aligned with our values:

  • Make others successful
  • Adapt to thrive
  • Play to wow
  • Think global
  • Experiment like an owner
Practicing equality through imagination work.

Mural is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workspaces where people can make a positive impact on the world and share their vision of how they achieve it. We are dedicated to working alongside multiple communities to help build this dream and bring it to life. 

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

results.title: Commercial Account Executive
results.description:

results.title: Sales Support Specialist
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a motivated Sales Support Specialist with your local office at Wilrijk (Antwerp). You play a key role in supporting our sales teams worldwide. As a communicative and administrative all-rounder, you are an essential link in the sales process within a commercial helpdesk. After all, you ensure that your sales colleagues can focus on what they do best: selling!

 

A day on the job
  • 8.45 AM: You come to the office and check your mailbox. One of our clients asked you to draw up an offer.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you start to process all the incoming orders from our clients. 
  • 10.45 AM: You have a central position and have regular contact with our sales, finance and consultancy department to support them whenever needed.
  • 11.30 AM: You schedule a short meeting with your manager to analyze and monitor our pipeline based on data collected from the system.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: When analyzing the sales process, you notice that there is room for improvement. So, you start to think about how we can optimize the whole process, taking into account the possibilities of our CRM system and the needs of our business.
  • 3 PM: You plan a call for next week to discuss the right CRM data and dashboards that our partners and sales has to use.
  • 4 PM: To end the day you make sure that our customer information is up to date.
What about the team?

As a Sales Support Specialist you will become part of a great international team. Your colleagues are located at the local office in The Netherlands. Together with your team, you support each other and work to a common goal. There is plenty of room for taking initiative and no day looks the same!

Could this be you?
  • You have experience in an administrative support function and an affinity with sales processes.
  • You have experience with CRM packages and are eager to develop your knowledge for new software packages and technologies.
  • You have a hands-on mentality and are willing to learn.
  • You have a bright personality and are commercially minded.
  • You are punctual and enjoy working in a team.
  • You speak and write fluent Dutch and have a good knowledge of English.
  • This position is also open if you want to work parttime (80% or 90%)
The challenges we see in this role
  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

 

How do we make this a win-win?

 

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges, will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings. 
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.
What would next steps look like?
  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

results.title: Director of Sales
results.description:
Title: Director of Sales

Term: Full-time

Compensation: $110,000 base salary, plus uncapped commission (target = $50k with upside)

Location: Remote, within the U.S.

Overview:

Solstice is an award-winning clean energy company working to put affordable renewable energy in the hands of every household, including low-income populations and communities of color. The clean energy revolution is happening now; Solstice is working to ensure this transition is equitable and widespread by making it simpler and more affordable than ever for homeowners, businesses, and even renters to go solar.

With surging demand for renewable energy, Solstice is poised for significant scale. As a result, we are seeking an experienced Director of Sales who can take our company to the next level of growth. The ideal candidate is organized, ambitious, mission-driven and a team player. This leader will manage our growing sales organization, which includes a Partnerships team (B2B sales, Energy Brokers and channel partnerships), Community Field Representatives and Enrollments team (B2C sales). The ideal candidate is goal- and results-oriented while fostering a people-first mentality with a high level of emotional intelligence.

This role will report to the Vice President of Revenue.

Responsibilities include:

  • Directly manage all members of the sales team (currently 8 people) which includes:
    • Partnerships team: initiates and cultivates partnerships with entities such as community-based support organizations / non profits, municipalities, religious organizations, housing authorities and service organizations, and others, to drive enrollment of their constituencies.
    • Channels team: drives sales through third-party organizations that sell on behalf of Solstice, including energy brokers, municipal energy aggregators, and door-to-door organizations.
    • Enrollments team: assists customers through the enrollment process for those that do not complete enrollment on their own.
  • Lead the creation of a new channel sales team that focuses on Community Based Relationships, targeting local businesses in low to moderate income neighborhoods.
  • Create a new Enterprise sales channel that focuses on nationally based products to socially-concerned, large, multinational corporations.
  • Hold team accountable to individual and team goals, identify and remove blockers, conduct regular 1:1s and performance reviews.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with potential referral sources and conduct field visits, as well as attend trade shows.
  • Monitor the overall results of selected communities’ sales efforts and make recommendations regarding necessary changes in marketing strategy, external business development initiatives and community sales performance metrics.
  • Effectively coach, mentor and train sales staff with a focus on relationship-based selling strategies (to include inquiry follow-up, advancement of sales and handling objections) to community-based partnerships.
  • Maintain centralized sales operational processes and structure for the sales team, including scripts, collateral, training materials, playbooks, etc.
  • Own overall sales strategy and channel breakdown; analyze and refine effectiveness of existing sales and outreach approaches.
  • Collaborate with the Revenue Operations team on sales forecasts, staffing models, and tracking/analysis of Sales KPIs.
  • Collaborate with other departments (including Marketing, Business Development, Customer Success) on cross functional initiatives (e.g. working with Marketing on creating a delightful customer experience).
  • Develop and implement the business plan, and forecast to achieve sales, market share, hit rates and market growth targets to attain overall financial goals, and fulfill all CRM reporting and data quality requirements.
  • Interface and manage relationships with solar developer partners during customer acquisition campaigns, reporting on progress to enrollment milestones and trends being seen in the market.

Requirements

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience managing both inbound and outbound sales teams and cultivating talent
  • Proven sales success using a consultative sales approach preferably in the clean energy industry
  • Salesforce.com proficiency; Outreach.io and Hubspot experience a plus
  • Experience developing sales processes and structures from the ground up
  • Track record of structuring, tracking, and improving KPIs and metrics
  • Previous professional experience growing sales teams within start-up organizations and/or clean energy
  • Ability to articulate Solstice’s value proposition to key stakeholders with passion
  • Knowledge of and relationships with key stakeholders in Solstice’s current and future geographic regions (Northeast US, specifically NY, IL, NJ and MA)
  • Ability and willingness to travel as needed

Benefits

As a Director of Sales, you will gain:

  • A deep understanding of the solar and renewable energy space, particularly the rapidly growing community solar industry
  • Hands on startup experience in cleantech
  • Personal interaction with senior management
  • Knowledge that you are positively contributing to environmental and social impact every day in your work: getting clean energy savings to households, deploying more solar projects in the world, and working to create a more just and equitable energy industry

In addition, every Solstice Power Technologies employee enjoys:

  • Competitive salary, dental coverage, and inclusive healthcare, including expense reimbursement for out-of-state reproductive care
  • 401k with matching
  • Professional development annual stipend
  • Gender-neutral paid parental leave policy
  • Five weeks of PTO a year, including when we close the office for ~1.5 weeks in late December each year
  • Flexible personal time to allow employees to run errands and go to doctor’s appointments without taking PTO
  • Ability to work remotely from within the United States
  • A team of passionate, collaborative, dedicated, and empathetic employees

About Solstice:

Climate change mitigation requires massive clean energy expansion, yet 77 percent of American households cannot install rooftop solar power due to rented housing, the structure of their rooftop, the upfront cost, or access to financing. Solstice connects households and community organizations to “community solar”—shared solar farms that are installed in a centralized location where local residents can enroll in a portion for free, without any home installations, and enjoy guaranteed savings on their monthly utility bill.

One of the only companies in the solar industry co-founded and led by women of color, Solstice has generated demand for nearly 139MW of clean energy across 43 community renewable projects in multiple states, with the total clean energy capacity from enrolled households, small businesses, and nonprofits representing the environmental equivalent of not burning 62 million pounds of coal. In addition, Solstice’s software manages the end-to-end customer experience for the life of the 20-year renewable energy project on behalf of developers and financiers, from customer enrollment to billing/crediting to ongoing customer engagement.

Solstice was founded to advance equity and inclusion in America. We are committed to living those values, not just in the work we do to promote environmental and energy justice, but in how we grow as an organization. We always seek to expand leadership opportunities for marginalized communities in the global transition to clean energy.

Solstice is an equal-opportunity employer. We hire, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, age, national origin, genetics, veteran status, or any of the other characteristics that give each of us a unique perspective and capacities.

We’re a team of mission-driven, passionate, and dedicated individuals. We’ve fostered an inclusive and fun culture through monthly outings, solar farm field trips, and all-team strategy retreats throughout the year. To ensure the health and safety of our teammates, all employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend in-person events. Apply today and get to know us!

Description

This is a remote position.

About Us
 
Sell2Rent is seeking a Head of Real Estate sales to join our remote team and be responsible for coordinating the sales team.
 
Sell2Rent is revolutionizing Real Estate by creating a platform that empowers homeowners to sell their homes (and stay in them as renters) to investors who want to acquire those properties. S2R will bring to mainstream America what corporate America has had for decades: Lease-Backs. We will allow homeowners to unlock equity from their most significant asset, their home while allowing them to stay as renters. Sell2Rent is a technology-first company that sees a giant opportunity in the single-family home market. Starting in the US and then globally. Every year over six million homes are sold in the US alone. How many can be sold when owners realize they can sell, cash out and stay in the homes they love?
 
About The Position
 
The Head of Sales is responsible for managing and overseeing the sales operations. she/he should have between 8+ years of experience with Real Estate Sales, designing plans to meet targets, developing relationships with clients/customers, training and onboarding the sales team.

Benefits
